name: 2.0-M5 Release
body: A bunch of new methods, bug fixes, and Javadoc improvements.

name: 2.0 Milestone 4 Update 1
body:
**New convenience methods:**
[EventStream#fork](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/2.0-M4u1/org/reactfx/EventStream.html#fork-java.util.function.Predicate-)
[EventStreams#fork](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/2.0-M4u1/org/reactfx/EventStreams.html#fork-org.reactfx.EventStream-)
[Val#conditionOn](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/2.0-M4u1/org/reactfx/value/Val.html#conditionOn-javafx.beans.value.ObservableValue-)
[Val#conditionOnShowing](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/2.0-M4u1/org/reactfx/value/Val.html#conditionOnShowing-javafx.scene.Node-)

name: 2.0 Milestone 4
body: Some fixes and little features, as well as deprecations. Update to address deprecations.

name: 2.0 Milestone 3
body:
This milestone adds animated values:
- [animate(Duration, Interpolator<T>)](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/2.0-M3/org/reactfx/value/Val.html#animate-java.time.Duration-org.reactfx.util.Interpolator-)
- [animate((T, T) -> Duration, Interpolator<T>)](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/2.0-M3/org/reactfx/value/Val.html#animate-java.util.function.BiFunction-org.reactfx.util.Interpolator-)

name: 2.0 Milestone 2 update 1
body: This is a small bugfix release for 2.0-M2

name: 2.0 Milestone 2
body:
New in this milestone:
- [Val](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/2.0-M2/org/reactfx/value/Val.html) as a better `ObservableValue`. It is a unifying concept of ObservableValue, Binding, EasyBind's MonadicObservableValue, InhiBeans' inhibitable ObservableValue, plus adopts the lazy binding known from EventStreams.
- [Var](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/2.0-M2/org/reactfx/value/Var.html) as a better `Property`.
- [LiveList](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/2.0-M2/org/reactfx/collection/LiveList.html) as a better `ObservableList`.

Other changes in this milestone:
- Error-reporting mechanism was removed.
- InhiBeans deprecated, since all functionality is now contained in `Val`, `Var` and `LiveList`.

There are other smaller additions and changes.

name: 2.0 Milestone 1
body:
This first milestone for 2.0 is about removing stuff and refactoring. It introduces a number of breaking changes:
- `BiEventStream`, `TriEventStream` and `EitherEventStream` are gone. The necessary code repetition in their implementation is not justified by the little gains in performance. In the future, hopefully, [project Valhalla](http://openjdk.java.net/projects/valhalla/) enables more efficient implementation of tuples as _value types_, getting back the performance benefits of `BiEventStream` and `TriEventStream`, without code repetition.
- Removed the deprecated `InterceptableEventStream`.
- The subscriber type is now [`Subscriber<T>`](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/2.0-M1/org/reactfx/Subscriber.html) instead of `Consumer<T>`.

name: 1.4.1 release
body:
New in this minor release:
- Allowed `reduceSuccessions` to be called on non-FX thread.
- Added [repeatOnInvalidation(Observable)](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventStreams.html#repeatOnInvalidation-O-) factory method for streams.
- Added [thenAccumulateFor](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventStream.html#thenAccumulateFor-java.time.Duration-java.util.function.Function-java.util.function.BiFunction-java.util.function.Function-), [thenReduceFor](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventStream.html#thenReduceFor-java.time.Duration-java.util.function.BinaryOperator-), [thenRetainLatestFor](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventStream.html#thenRetainLatestFor-java.time.Duration-) and [thenIgnoreFor](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventStream.html#thenIgnoreFor-java.time.Duration-) combinators.
- Added [combine](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventStreams.html#combine-org.reactfx.EventStream-org.reactfx.EventStream-org.reactfx.EventStream-org.reactfx.EventStream-org.reactfx.EventStream-org.reactfx.EventStream-) for up to 6 event streams.
- Better support for observing `ObservableList` changes: [EventStreams.simpleChangesOf](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventStreams.html#simpleChangesOf-javafx.collections.ObservableList-).

name: 1.4 release
body: Improved error-reporting: errors are printed to stderr if no handler provided.

name: 1.3 release
body:
New in this release:

**Controlling recursive event emission.** Recursive event emission happens when an event causes the stream to emit again. Basically, recursion is disallowed when there is more than one subscriber to the stream, since if the first notified subscriber caused recursive emission, the following subscribers would receive events in reverse order. To allow recursive emission and 2 or more subscribers at the same time, one has to explicitly state how to handle recursive emission, via the `onRecurse*()` methods.

**Suspendable event streams.** Interceptable event streams were simplified (mostly implementation-wise) and are now called [_suspendable_ event streams](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/SuspendableEventStream.html). There's a special operator to get each type of suspendable event stream: [suppressible](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventStream.html#suppressible--), [forgetful](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventStream.html#forgetful--), [pausable](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventStream.html#pausable--), [reducible](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventStream.html#reducible-java.util.function.BinaryOperator-), [accumulative](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventStream.html#accumulative-java.util.function.Function-java.util.function.BiFunction-java.util.function.Function-), [accumulative](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventStream.html#accumulative-java.util.function.Supplier-java.util.function.BiFunction-java.util.function.Function-).

**New stream combinators:**
[suppressWhen](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventStream.html#suppressWhen-javafx.beans.value.ObservableValue-), [retainLatestWhen](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventStream.html#retainLatestWhen-javafx.beans.value.ObservableValue-), [pauseWhen](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventStream.html#pauseWhen-javafx.beans.value.ObservableValue-), [reduceWhen](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventStream.html#reduceWhen-javafx.beans.value.ObservableValue-java.util.function.BinaryOperator-), [accumulateWhen](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventStream.html#accumulateWhen-javafx.beans.value.ObservableValue-java.util.function.Function-java.util.function.BiFunction-java.util.function.Function-), [accumulateWhen](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventStream.html#accumulateWhen-javafx.beans.value.ObservableValue-java.util.function.Supplier-java.util.function.BiFunction-java.util.function.Function-),
[retainLatestUntilLater](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventStream.html#retainLatestUntilLater--), [queueUntilLater](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventStream.html#queueUntilLater--), [reduceUntilLater](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventStream.html#reduceUntilLater-java.util.function.BinaryOperator-), [accumulateUntilLater](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventStream.html#accumulateUntilLater-java.util.function.Function-java.util.function.BiFunction-java.util.function.Function-), [accumulateUntilLater](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventStream.html#accumulateUntilLater-java.util.function.Supplier-java.util.function.BiFunction-java.util.function.Function-),
[queueBetween](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventStream.html#queueBetween-org.reactfx.EventStream-), [reduceBetween](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventStream.html#reduceBetween-org.reactfx.EventStream-java.util.function.BinaryOperator-), [accumulateBetween](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventStream.html#accumulateBetween-org.reactfx.EventStream-java.util.function.Function-java.util.function.BiFunction-java.util.function.Function-), [accumulateBetween](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventStream.html#accumulateBetween-org.reactfx.EventStream-java.util.function.Supplier-java.util.function.BiFunction-java.util.function.Function-).

name: 1.2.2 release
body: This is a bug fix release, thanks to @iSerge.

name: 1.2.1 release
body:
- Added `exec()` and `flatMap()` methods to `Either`.
- Added `exec()` methods to tuples.
- Added `EventStream.watch(subscriber, monitor)` method as a convenient shortcut to `subscribe(subscriber).and(monitor(monitor))`.
- Deprecated `EitherEventStream` because of questionable utility.
- Added `EventStream.mapToBi()` and `mapToTri()` that return a `BiEventStream` and `TriEventStream`, respectively.

name: 1.2.0 release
body:
New in this release:
- [Error-reporting mechanism](https://github.com/TomasMikula/ReactFX/wiki/Error-Handling).
- [Variants](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/Subscription.html#multi-java.util.function.Function-java.util.Collection-) [of](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/Subscription.html#multi-java.util.function.Function-T...-) [`Subscription.multi(...)`](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/Subscription.html#multi-org.reactfx.Subscription...-) that _"subscribe"_ to arbitrary elements.
- [`Subscription.dynamic(ObservableSet<T>, Function<T,Subscription>)`](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/Subscription.html#dynamic-javafx.collections.ObservableSet-java.util.function.Function-) to dynamically subscribe to elements of an observable set.
- [`EventStreams.sizeOf(...)`](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventStreams.html#sizeOf-C-) factory methods to emit the current size of an observable collection.
- Added [`Connectable`](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/Connectable.html) interface for objects that are capable of _lazily_ subscribing to event streams.
  - Added [`ConnectableEventSource`](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/ConnectableEventSource.html), an event source that lazily subscribes to any number of event streams, i.e. it is subscribed to its input streams only when it itself has at least one subscriber.

name: 1.1.3 release
body:
New in this release:
- Added [EventStream.feedTo(WritableValue)](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventStream.html#feedTo-javafx.beans.value.WritableValue-) method.
- Added [accumulate(...)](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventStream.html#accumulate-java.util.function.BinaryOperator-) operators.
- Added [toStateStream()](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/StateMachine.ObservableStateBuilder.html#toStateStream--) method to the state machine builder.
- Added [Subscription.multi(ObservableSet<T>, T -> Subscription)](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/Subscription.html#multi-javafx.collections.ObservableSet-java.util.function.Function-) method to dynamically subscribe to elements of an observable set.
- Added a version of [merge](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventStreams.html#merge-javafx.collections.ObservableSet-) that merges all event streams in an observable set.
- Added more convenient methods on tuples, Either and EitherEventStream.
- Added [EventStream.test(Predicate)](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventStream.html#test-java.util.function.Predicate-) operator.
- Added [Try](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/util/Try.html) type.

name: 1.1.2 release
body:
New in this release:
- Added [EitherEventStream](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EitherEventStream.html), a specialized stream for events of type `Either<L, R>`.
- Added [supply(U)](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventStream.html#supply-U-) combinator to replace the emitted event with a constant value.
- Added [EventStreams.eventsOf(Scene, EventType)](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventStreams.html#eventsOf-javafx.scene.Scene-javafx.event.EventType-) factory method to create a stream of events on a Scene. This complements the `EventStreams.eventsOf(Node, EventType)` method present in ReactFX from the start.

name: 1.1.1 release
body: This is a minor release that only adds the [distinct()](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventStream.html#distinct--) combinator (thanks to @sinicyn).

name: 1.1.0 release
body:
This release contains some backwards incompatible changes.

This is also the first release with a third-party contribution. Thanks, @sinicyn!

Changes in this release:
- Streams returned from `reduceSuccessions` and `await` now indicate whether there is a pending event. This change is source compatible, but not binary compatible with the previous release, because the return of those methods has changed.
- Added [cast(Class<U>)](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventStream.html#cast-java.lang.Class-) combinator to conveniently downcast the events emitted by the stream.
- Added [emitOnEach(impulse)](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventStream.html#emitOnEach-org.reactfx.EventStream-) and [repeatOn(impulse)](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventStream.html#repeatOn-org.reactfx.EventStream-) combinators.
- Added [EventStreams.nonNullValuesOf(ObservableValue<T>)](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventStreams.html#nonNullValuesOf-javafx.beans.value.ObservableValue-) factory method.
- `Sink` was renamed to [EventSink](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventSink.html).
- Bi- and tri-valued EventStreams, EventSinks and EventSources are provided for convenience: [BiEventStream](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/BiEventStream.html), [BiEventSink](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/BiEventSink.html), [BiEventSource](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/BiEventSource.html), [TriEventStream](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/TriEventStream.html), [TriEventSink](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/TriEventSink.html), [TriEventSource](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/TriEventSource.html).
- [zip](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventStreams.html#zip-org.reactfx.EventStream-org.reactfx.EventStream-) and [combine](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventStreams.html#combine-org.reactfx.EventStream-org.reactfx.EventStream-) now return multi-valued streams directly. This is a backwards-incompatible change.
- Added a convenience [flatMapOpt](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventStream.html#flatMapOpt-java.util.function.Function-) combinator.
- Added [Either<A, B>](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/util/Either.html) type and [or](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventStream.html#or-org.reactfx.EventStream-) combinator.
- Added methods to connect an EventSink to an EventStream: [EventStream.feedTo(EventSink)](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventStream.html#feedTo-org.reactfx.EventSink-) and [EventSink.feedFrom(EventStream)](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventSink.html#feedFrom-org.reactfx.EventStream-).
- Exposed internally used [FxTimer](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/util/FxTimer.html) as public API.
- Added [EventStreams.ticks(interval)](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventStreams.html#ticks-java.time.Duration-) factory method to create a stream of periodic ticks.
- A number of deprecated APIs were removed.

name: 1.0.2 release
body:
- Added `newSubscriber` hook to `EventStreamBase` to be called for each new subscriber.
- `valuesOf()` stream now re-emits the current value for each new subscriber.
- Added `flatMap` combinator.
- Support for out of order unblocking of InhiBeans and Indicator.
- Added `reduce` and `toArray` methods to `ListHelper`.

name: 1.0.1 release
body:
- Added the [Guardian](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/Guardian.html) interface.
- Added the [EventStream.guardedBy(Guardian...)](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventStream.html#guardedBy-org.reactfx.Guardian...-) method.
- Added [asynchronously mapped streams](http://tomasmikula.github.io/blog/2014/04/25/combining-reactfx-and-asynchronous-processing.html).
- Added a convenience [successionEnds](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventStream.html#successionEnds-java.time.Duration-) method.
- Added the [supply](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventStream.html#supply-java.util.function.Supplier-) "combinator".
- Added the [pin](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventStream.html#pin--) method to keep lazily bound streams bound.
- Added the [hook](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/EventStream.html#hook-java.util.function.Consumer-) method useful for debugging.
- Added [state machine](http://tomasmikula.github.io/blog/2014/05/01/reactfxs-general-stream-combinator-state-machine.html) as a generalized stream combinator.
- Added a convenient implementation of [tuples](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/util/Tuples.html).
- Added an [inhibitory ObservableList wrapper](http://www.reactfx.org/javadoc/org/reactfx/inhibeans/collection/Collections.html#wrap-javafx.collections.ObservableList-) to InhiBeans.

name: 1.0.0 release
body: First release.
